title: A shooter killed 6 people in a small Mississippi town. A suspect is in custody
description: The shooting occurred in Arkabutla in rural Mississippi, near the Tennessee state line, officials said.

title: Is it safe to go home? With hard hats and phone apps, Turkey's engineers seek answers
description: NPR follows one of the hundreds of building inspectors in Turkey's earthquake zone to learn about the massive challenge of figuring how who can return to their homes.

title: With fake paperwork and a roguish attitude, he made the San Francisco Bay his gallery
description: For decades, small sculptures would pop up along the San Francisco shoreline: whimsical sculptures of biplanes, like the Red Baron, perched on pier pilings. This is the story of the man behind them.

title: CNN's Don Lemon apologizes for sexist remarks about Nikki Haley
description: The CNN anchor publicly apologized for comments about when women "are in their prime" during a show that aired Thursday.

title: Indian authorities accuse the BBC of tax evasion after raiding their offices
description: Press freedom advocates around the world have decried this week's raids on the BBC — in which journalists and accountants alike were questioned, and had their phones and laptops searched.

title: The human sensory experience is limited. Journey into the world that animals know
description: Science writer Ed Yong recently won the Carnegie Medal for Excellence for An Immense World, his book about the diversity of perception in the animal world. Originally broadcast June 22, 2022.

title: André Leon Talley's belongings, including capes and art, net $3.5 million at auction
description: Christie's auctioned off hundreds of items belonging to the late fashion icon this week. Top-selling items included Andy Warhol paintings and some of Talley's signature custom coats.

title: Why hundreds of doctors are lobbying in Washington this week
description: They came to tell Congress about their "recovery plan" for physicians, which includes a Medicare pay boost and an end to some frustrating insurance company requirements.

title: A white Louisiana police officer is charged with killing an unarmed Black man
description: After reviewing evidence and bodycam footage, state troopers charged Shreveport Police Officer Alexander Tyler, 23, with negligent homicide in the Feb. 3 shooting death of Alonzo Bagley, 43.

title: 11 days after the quake, a few more survivors are pulled from the rubble in Turkey
description: Even as the death toll in Turkey and Syria has risen to more than 41,000, search teams in southern Turkey have rescued a few people who were trapped in the debris.

title: 2 Jewish men were shot leaving their synagogues in LA. A suspect is in custody
description: Both victims survived the shootings, which happened just blocks apart early Wednesday and Thursday. City officials say the incidents are being investigated as potential hate crimes.

title: U.S. prosecutors ask for 25 more years in prison for R. Kelly
description: The additional sentence from last year's child pornography and enticement convictions in Chicago would add to 30 years the R&B singer and songwriter recently began serving in a New York case.

title: 5 ex-officers charged with killing Tyre Nichols set to appear in Memphis court today
description: They will be arraigned charges of murder, assault, and other felonies. Tyre Nichols died three days after the officers beat him following a Jan. 7 traffic stop.

title: Is the economy headed for recession or a soft landing?
description: Are we in a recession? It seems like a straightforward question, but the data tells conflicting stories.

title: Japan recounted its islands. Now geographers say there may be 7,000 more of them
description: Japan conducted a recount of its islands amid criticism that the data was old and inaccurate. Geographers took another look and the number of islands is expected to more than double.

title: Militaries have sought to use spy balloons for centuries. The real enemy is the wind
description: The U.S. government suspects that China's surveillance balloon may have blown off course. It wouldn't be the first time.

title: Doug Emhoff has made antisemitism his issue, but says it's everyone's job to fight it
description: Second gentleman Doug Emhoff, the husband of Vice President Harris, is increasingly focused on combating antisemitism at home and abroad. He spoke to NPR about his historic role.

title: Actor Bruce Willis has frontotemporal dementia. Here's what to know about the disease
description: Willis family announced Thursday that his previous diagnosis of aphasia has progressed to frontotemporal dementia. The disease can cause issues with speaking and writing.

title: Taiwan reports that a Chinese weather balloon was found on an outlying island
description: Taiwan's Defense Ministry said the balloon carried equipment registered to a state-owned electronics company in the northern city of Taiyuan.

title: A power outage at a JFK Airport terminal disrupts flights
description: The outage at Terminal 1 was caused by an electrical panel failure, the airport said. Flights, including international ones, are being affected.

title: The suspect charged with killing 7 people at 2 California farms pleads not guilty
description: A gag order has been issued that prohibits the attorneys, the suspect and the county sheriff's office from talking to reporters about the facts of the case or sharing opinions about what happened.

title: Off the air, Fox News stars blasted the election fraud claims they peddled
description: Fox News stars, including Tucker Carlson and Sean Hannity, privately derided then-President Donald Trump's assertion he'd been cheated of victory in 2020, even as the network amplified such claims.
